topics.topic_html:
Sentence

A group of words which gives complete sense,is called sentence


Kind Of Sentence
  • Assertive
  • Interrogative
  • Imperative
  • Exclamatory

Assertive Sentence

A sentence that give information


Kind of Assertive Sentence
ParameterAffirmativeNegative
Structuresub + hv + mv + objTanu is going to London
Examplesub + hv + not + mv + objTanu is not going to London

Interrogative Sentence

A sentence that ask question

Kind of Interrogative
  • Direct
    • Yes/No Question
    • Wh Question
  • Indirect
Direct Interrogative

An Interrogative Sentence which refer direct question

pYes/No QuestionWh-Question
Structurehv + sub + mv + objAre you going there ?
Examplewh + hv + sub + mv + objWhy are you going there ?

Note :  If yes/no questions and wh-questions come together in a single sentence,in this case the first sentence will be in interrogative form and the second sentence must be in assertive form 

assertivesub + hv + mv + obj
interrogativewh + hv + sub + mv + obj

May I know why you do not talk to him?

  • Qn . May I know where are you going?
         - May I know where you are going?
  • Qn . Could you tell me why did you not speak the truth?
     -     Could you tell me why you did not speak the truth
  • Qn . May I know why you do not talk to him?
      -    correct
  • Qn . May I know whom do you want to talk to ?
     -     May I know whom you want to talk to
          because do,does came when sentence has not or the sentence is presend indefinite with 3rd person
  • Qn . Do you know when he shall be leaving for his higher studies in the usa.
      -    currect (because the assertive structure is ok)

summary : when a sentence contain 2 interrogative part then the first one should maintain interrogative structure and the second one should maintain assertive sturcture

Indirect Interrogative

Note : Indirect Interrogarive doesnt have anything to do with the interrogative structure.Nither hv comes before subject nor question mark ? comes at the end of the sentence

I want to know what your name is
   assertive         interrogative

QN . He cordially enquired how was my health
   -  . He cordially enquired how my health was

Qn . I did not understand why did you not call me last night.
  -  . I did not understand why you did not call me last night.

Qn . Newton wanted to know why did the apple fall on the ground
   - . Newton wanted to know why the apple fell on the ground
       as did refer past form so the verb solve will be solved

Qn . I asked him why did he call me a fool
   - . I asked him why he called me a fool

Qn . They could not tell me why did he call his father
    - . They could not tell me why he called his father

Qn . Please explain me how did you solve this question
   - . Please explain me how you solveed this question

Qn . The teacher asked the intruder who was he and why was he occupying his chair?
   -  . The teacher asked the intruder who he was and why he was occupying his chair.(dot)

Imperative

to express Order,Advise,Request

Advise(verb) (refer giving Advice)
Advice(Noun) (refer only Advice)

Structure: start with V1,Do,Do not,Let 
Example
1  . work hard
2 . Do work hard
3 . Do not talk to her
4 . Please,Finist the work

Exclamatory

To Express Strong felling,Emotions,Reactions
structure:start with What/how

Interjections -Hurrah!,Wow!

Example:1.What a movie
        2.Hurrah! I got selected for the job

Optative Sentence:
1.part of Exclamatory Sentence
2.To express Blessing,Curse,Wish

structure: May + sub+ v1!
         or May + sub + v1 

Example:1.May God bless you!
        2.May you rot in hell
